reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

title.narrative: Improving Women?s SRHR through Expanded Access to Comprehensive Abortion Care and Prevention of Unwanted Pregnancy

description.narrative: Founded in 1973 Ipas is an international non-governmental organization whose mission is to reduce maternal deaths and disabilities from unsafe abortion and to increase women?s ability to exercise their sexual and reproductive rights.Ipas believes that ever y woman has a basic human right to make safe reproductive choices. The organization works to integrate woman-centered comprehensive abortion care (CAC)?including safe elective abortion postabortion care contraception and links to other reproductive health services?into national health systems with emphasis on capacity-building quality of care and sustainability. Ipas?s key strengths include:- a global pool of clinicians trained in safe abortion care,- technical expertise in improving abortion-related servic es of public and privatehealth systems including standards and guidelines and in communitymobilization and engagement,- technical leadership and support in policy and advocacy research andevaluation.Ipas has offices and a multidisciplinary international st aff based in 16 countries: Ethiopia Ghana Kenya (serving Kenya and the Africa region) Malawi Nigeria Sierra Leone Zambia Bangladesh India Myanmar Nepal Pakistan Bolivia Mexico Nicaragua (serving Central America) and the United States (headquarters). The or ganization conducts activities in more than 15 additional countries in collaboration with local partners. Ipas?s work is supported mainly by private foundations and governments including the United Kingdom the Netherlands Sweden Norway and Finland.Ipas col laborates with a wide range of global regional and local organizations including ministries of health health professional organizations women?s health networks lawyers youth groups research organizations media and a wide range of health and development NGO s. Ipas is an NGO in special consultative status with the Economic and Social Council of the United Nations.The organization's core functions are supported with a total of 2.2 million euros in 2015-2016.
